SERVER_IP.description: The IP address of the server where all services will be running. It wil typically be the IP address of your server in your local network/home network

DOMAIN.description: The following is the "rightmost" part of the URL to access the services. This must be a subdomain of a public domain you own. For example, if you own the domain "example.com", then you can use "home.example.com" as this domain.

ADGUARD.description: DNS server with ad blocking for the home network. See https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardHome

PORT.description: Internal port for the web interface

PASSWORD.description: Password for the web interface. The username is "admin"

CONF_PATH.description: Path for AdGuard Home configuration files

WORK_PATH.description: Path for AdGuard Home working files

CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN.description: CloudFlare API token. You should create a new API token from CloudFlare Dashboard -> Profile -> API Tokens

CLOUDFLARE_API_EMAIL.description: CloudFlare API email. This is the email you used to log into CloudFlare to create the API token

CALIBRE.description: Service to store and convert ebooks. See https://github.com/crocodilestick/Calibre-Web-Automated

PORT.description: Internal port for the web interface

INGEST_PATH.description: Path for ebooks to be ingested

LIBRARY_PATH.description: Path where the Calibre library is stored

PAPERLESS_WEB.description: A document management service. See https://github.com/paperless-ngx/paperless-ngx and http://docs.paperless-ngx.com/configuration/

PORT.description: Internal port for the web interface

MEDIA_PATH.description: Path for Paperless media files. This is where the original documents are stored

EXPORT_PATH.description: Path for Paperless export files. This is where Paperless will store the exported documents when we run the export script

PAPERLESS_REDIS.description: Redis database for the Paperless service

PAPERLESS_DB.description: SQL database for the Paperless service

IMMICH_WEB.description: Photo and video management service. See https://github.com/immich-app/immich

PORT.description: Internal port for the web interface

UPLOAD_PATH.description: Path for Immich data. This is where original photos and videos are stored

IMMICH_DB.description: SQL database for the Immich service

IMMICH_ML.description: Container that adds machine learning capabilities to the Immich service

CONTAINER_NAME.description: The container's name. IMPORTANT: if this is NOT the default "immich-machine-learning", then this hostname has to be set in Immich's server settings via the web interface

IMMICH_REDIS.description: Redis database for the Immich service

PORTAINER.description: Service for managing Docker infrastructure. See https://github.com/portainer/portainer

PORT.description: Internal port for the web interface
Internal port for the web interface

UPLOAD_PATH.description: Path to upload files that Firefly can ingest

APP_ENV.description: You can leave this on "local". If you change it to production most console commands will ask for extra confirmation. Never set it to "testing".

APP_DEBUG.description: Set to true if you want to see debug information in error screens.

SITE_OWNER.description: This should be your email address. The variable is used in some errors shown to users who aren't admin.

APP_KEY.description: The encryption key for your sessions. Keep this very secure. Change it to a string of exactly 32 chars. Avoid the character #, it may break things

DEFAULT_LANGUAGE.description: Firefly III will launch using this language (for new users and unauthenticated visitors)

DEFAULT_LOCALE.description: The locale defines how numbers are formatted. By default this value is the same as whatever the language is.

TRUSTED_PROXIES.description: Useful variable when using Docker and/or a reverse proxy. Set it to ** and reverse proxies work just fine.

LOG_CHANNEL.description: The log channel defines where your log entries go to. Several options exist. You can use 'single' for one big fat error log (not recommended). Also available are 'syslog', 'errorlog' and 'stdout' which will log to the system itself. A rotating log option is 'daily', creates 5 files that (surprise) rotate. A cool option is 'papertrail' for cloud logging. Default setting 'stack' will log to 'daily' and to 'stdout' at the same time.

LOG_LEVEL.description: Log level. You can set this from least severe to most severe: debug, info, notice, warning, error, critical, alert, emergency. If you set it to debug your logs will grow large, and fast. If you set it to emergency probably nothing will get logged, ever.

AUDIT_LOG_LEVEL.description: Audit log level. The audit log is used to log notable Firefly III events on a separate channel. These log entries may contain sensitive financial information. The audit log is disabled by default. To enable it, set AUDIT_LOG_LEVEL to "info". To disable it, set AUDIT_LOG_LEVEL to "emergency"

AUDIT_LOG_CHANNEL.description: If you want, you can redirect the audit logs to another channel. Set 'audit_stdout', 'audit_syslog', 'audit_errorlog' to log to the system itself. Use audit_daily to log to a rotating file. Use audit_papertrail to log to papertrail. If you do this, the audit logs may be mixed with normal logs because the settings for these channels are often the same as the settings for the normal logs

DB_CONNECTION.description: The database connection to use. For other database types, see the FAQ: https://docs.firefly-iii.org/references/faq/install/#i-want-to-use-sqlite

MYSQL_USE_SSL.description: MySQL supports SSL. You can configure it here. (NOTE: several related environment variables omitted by me...)

CACHE_DRIVER.description: The cache driver. If you're looking for performance improvements, you could install memcached or redis. (NOTE: all Redis config variables are omitted by me...)

COOKIE_PATH.description: The cookie path. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings

COOKIE_DOMAIN.description: The cookie domain. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings

COOKIE_SECURE.description: The cookie secure flag. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings

COOKIE_SAMESITE.description: The cookie samesite flag. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings. Setting to "strict" may give you trouble logging in

ENABLE_EXTERNAL_MAP.description: Set this value to true if you want to set the location of certain things, like transactions. Since this involves an external service, it's optional and disabled by default. (NOTE: some other environment variables related to the map omitted by me...)

ENABLE_EXCHANGE_RATES.description: Enable or disable exchange rate conversion

AUTHENTICATION_GUARD.description: Firefly III supports a few authentication methods, such as 'web' (default, uses built in DB) or 'remote_user_guard' (for Authelia etc). Read more about these settings in the documentation: https://docs.firefly-iii.org/how-to/firefly-iii/advanced/authentication/

USE_RUNNING_BALANCE.description: Disable or enable the running balance column data. Please disable this. It's a very experimental feature

LAYOUT.description: The v2 layout is very experimental. If it breaks you get to keep both parts. Be wary of data loss

QUERY_PARSER_IMPLEMENTATION.description: Which Query Parser implementation to use for the search engine and rules. 'new' is experimental, 'legacy' is the classic one

FIREFLY_DB.description: SQL database for the Firefly service

PORT.description: Internal port for the web interface

BACKUP.description: Variables for the backup scripts that use Restic with Backblaze B2. These variables do not correspond to any container

RESTIC_REPOSITORY.description: The repository to use for backups

RESTIC_PASSWORD.description: The password to use for Restic. It is used to encrypt the backup files

PATH.description: Path to save the backup files into. Please note, all data you want to backup will be copy-pasted into this folder. Make sure you have enough disk space

RETENTION_DAYS.description: How many days to keep the backup files. Backups older than this number of days will be purged
